trans:
ğŸ’¥ğŸ’¥A must-watch movie for those interested in the history and human rights issues during the Japanese colonial era in Korea.ğŸ’¥ğŸ’¥
Living as immigrants in Australia, facing discrimination against our fundamental rights, is challenging. The students and their families in this movie experienced the same struggles.
ğŸ’¥ The movie depicts over 70 years of discrimination against Koreans in Japan after liberation, telling the story of a Japanese Joseon school that fought to protect Korean language and culture!
"Discrimination" follows a long litigation process when only Korean Chosun schools were excluded from the mandatory higher education system for high school students of the same age. It highlights the struggles of Koreans in Japan who have been attending Korean schools for over 70 years and the various people who supported these Joseon schools in both Korea and Japan.
â¤ï¸Part 1 â€“ Movie Screening
â¤ï¸Part 2 â€“ Q&A with Director Kim Ji-woon
